page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered is divided into the civil parishes of King's Somborne, Bossington, Michelmersh and Mottisfont. It is part of the Test Valley and is predominantly rural. The River Test flows through the middle of the block from North to South, to the west high chalk hills come down to water meadows with rolling farmland beyond the river to the east. The country is partly wooded to the west. The main road from Romsey to Stockbridge, an important through route, winds its way roughly parallel with the river. Large agricultural estates farm much of the area, and the river fishing is well_ managed and expensive. The two villages Mottisfont and Michelmersh are small, old and quietly rural.
